math_formula:
$$
\begin{aligned}
&\text{Maximize} && \sum_{j=1}^m c_j X_j \\
&\text{Subject to} && \sum_{j=1}^m \frac{1}{a_j} X_j \leq b \\
& && 0 \leq X_j \leq u_j \quad \forall j = 1, 2, \ldots, m
\end{aligned}
$$
natural_language_example: A company produces multiple products, each with a specific profit margin (c_j), resource usage (1/a_j), and production capacity limit (u_j). The company aims to maximize its total profit while ensuring that the total resource usage does not exceed a given budget (b). The decision variables (X_j) represent the quantity of each product to produce, constrained by their respective production limits.
